name: Football for Dummies #6 Quiz | World  Football Challenge | 10 Questions

questions.text: In a 2004 poll for Channel 4 Television in the UK, Gary Lineker was voted into England's greatest ever team. Which other striker made the squad?
questions.explanation:
Alan Shearer.

	The team in full was: Sir Alf Ramsay (manager), Gordon Banks (goal), Stuart Pearce (left back), George Cohen (right back), Tony Adams & Bobby Moore (centre backs), Tom Finney (left wing), David Beckham (right wing), Paul Gascoigne & Bobby Charlton (centre midfield), Alan Shearer & Gary Lineker (strikers). The poll left out such greats as Bryan Robson, Duncan Edwards, and Jack Charlton.

questions.text: Which player scored the first goal of Euro 2004?
questions.explanation:
Giorgios Karagounis (Greece).

	In a game that stunned the hosts, Greece won 2-1. Karagounis scored after 7 minutes, and the lead was doubled in the 51st after Basinas scored from the penalty spot. Ronaldo got a consolation for Portugal in the last minute of play.

questions.text: Which team did Steven Gerrard sign for in June, 2004?
questions.explanation:
None of these.

	Gerrard opted to stay with the Anfield Road club, instead of a widely tipped move to Stamford Bridge and Chelsea.

questions.text: Which of these teams did Sir Bobby Robson never manage?
questions.explanation:
Norwich City.

	Robson was manager of Fulham for 10 months in 1968. In 1969, he took over the hot seat at Ipswich, and stayed until 1982. Between 1982 and 1999, Robson had spells at PSV Eindhoven, Barcelona and England. In 1999, he became the manager of Newcastle United.

questions.text: Which of these players had the nickname 'Chopper'?
questions.explanation:
Ron Harris.

	Ron 'Chopper' Harris became a legend at Chelsea for his aggressive style of play. Neil Ruddock had the nickname of 'Razor', Norman Hunter was 'bite yer legs', and Joe Jordan was known as 'Jaws'.

questions.text: Which of these players was never involved in a transfer across the Pennines between Leeds United and Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Andrei Kanchelskis.

	Strachan moved from Manchester United to Leeds in 1989, and stayed until 1995. Alan Smith signed for the Old Trafford outfit in May, 2004. Rio Ferdinand moved to Manchester United in July, 2002.

questions.text: What nationality is world-renowned referee, Pierluigi Collina?
questions.explanation:
Italian.

	Collina was regarded by many as the best referee in the world, and officiated his last game for UEFA in Euro 2004. His other career highlights include the 1999 European Champions League final.

questions.text: What was Diego Maradona's lesser-used middle name?
questions.explanation:
Armando.

	While Armando was indeed Maradona's middle name, Luis was Jose Brown's, Omar was Gabriel Batistuta's, and Pablo was Juan Sorin's.

questions.text: What is the real name of West Ham United's Upton Park ground?
questions.explanation:
Boleyn Ground.

	East London's West Ham United began playing at the Boleyn Ground in 1903, after leaving the Memorial Recreation Ground.

questions.text: Who scored the last ever goal for Manchester City at Maine Road ground before they moved to the City of Manchester Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Marc-Vivien Foe.

	Foe scored twice as City beat Sunderland 3-0. Shortly afterwards, he died on the pitch playing for Cameroon, and City have since retired his squad number.
